net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Interface HTMLClassifier

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Action
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAction, ButtonDisplay, CollapsibleContainerDisplay, Column, ComponentDisplay, DelegatingAction, FieldDisplay, HTMLClassifierImpl, ListDisplay, MediaDisplay, NavigationAction, PagingDisplay, ReflectiveAction, RichListDisplay, Row, StateEventAction, TabDisplay, TabItemDisplay, TableDisplay, TextAreaDisplay, ToggleVisibilityAction, TreeDisplay

    public interface HTMLClassifier
    Represents an HTML classifier.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

    • Method Detail

      • addClassName

        void addClassName(@Nullable
                  java.lang.String string)
        Add an individual class to the display class if it doesn't already exist.
        Parameters:
        string - the class.

      • appendDisplayClass

        void appendDisplayClass(@Nullable
                        java.lang.String string)
        Append a value to the display class. If no display class is set the argument becomes the display class. Otherwise a space is appended to the existing display class and then the argument.

        You can use this method to set multiple classes at once. This method does not check to see if the class names already exist in the display class string.

        Parameters:
        string - the string to append.

      • getDisplayClass

        @Nullable
java.lang.String getDisplayClass()
        Get the display class.
        Returns:
        String, may be null.

      • hasClassName

        boolean hasClassName(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String string)
        Return true if the specified class is present in the display class.
        Parameters:
        string - the class.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • removeClassName

        void removeClassName(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String string)
        Remove an individual class from the display class if it exists.
        Parameters:
        string - the class.

      • replaceClassName

        boolean replaceClassName(@Nullable
                         java.lang.String oldString,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String newString)
        Replace an individual class from the display class if it exists with another class.
        Parameters:
        oldString - the old class.
        newString - the new class.
        Returns:
        true if the class was replaced or false if it wasn't.

      • setDisplayClass

        void setDisplayClass(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String string)
        Set the display class.

        You can use this method to set multiple classes at once.

        Parameters:
        string - The display class or null.

      • toggleClassName

        default void toggleClassName(@Nullable
                             java.lang.String string)
        Toggle an individual class name.
        Parameters:
        string - the class.
